dcterms:creator: Stefano V. Albrecht
Subramanian Ramamoorthy
dcterms:description: The level-based foraging (LBF) environment contains diverse tasks in which agents and food are randomly scattered in a gridworld. Agents observe their own location as well as all other agents and food, and can choose between discrete actions. Agents can only pick-up food if the level of all agents standing next to the food and choosing the pick-up action together is greater than or equal to the level of the food.
dcterms:title: Level-Based Foraging (LBF)

dcterms:creator: Filippos Christianos
Georgios Papoudakis
Stefano V. Albrecht
dcterms:description: In the boulder-push environment, agents navigate a gridworld to move a boulder to a target location. Agents observe the location of the boulder, other agents, and the direction the boulder needs to be pushed. Cooperation is required to successfully push the boulder.
dcterms:title: Boulder-Push (BPUSH)

dcterms:creator: Aleksandar Krnjaic
Jonathan D Thomas
Georgios Papoudakis
Lukas Schäfer
Peter Börsting
Stefano V. Albrecht
dcterms:description: The multi-robot warehouse environment represents gridworld warehouses with blocks of shelves. Agents navigate the warehouse to collect requested items, observing nearby agents and shelves. The tasks are characterized by sparse rewards, making them challenging exploration problems.
dcterms:title: Multi-Robot Warehouse (RWARE)

dcterms:creator: Ryan Lowe
Yi Wu
Aviv Tamar
Jean Harb
Pieter Abbeel
Igor Mordatch
dcterms:description: The multi-agent particle environment consists of continuous two-dimensional, fully-observable environments where agents navigate and cooperate to achieve densely rewarded objectives. Tasks include predator-prey scenarios, spreading to cover landmarks, and adversarial interactions.
dcterms:title: Multi-Agent Particle Environment (MPE)
